function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Behavior patterns of individuals unwilling to conform with public health requirements","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Pivot to virtual delivery of education, experiences, and commerce","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic complicating efforts to realize a \\'just transition\\'","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability of global society to disconnection bans and energy bill deferral","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exacerbation of existing health care inequalities among minority groups due to the pandemic","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Compounding environmental injustices due to covid-19 impact on vulnerable populations","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Usurpation of regulatory processes by powerful incumbent interests during the pandemic","category":"Leadership","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty regarding the lasting impact of the pandemic on social and political practices, including telework, travel, and mobility","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Forced reduction of quarantine period","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fantasies of biological and technological fix in pandemic crisis management","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Homeless individuals unable to comply with lockdown rules","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Police intervention and use of force against homeless individuals","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited means and resources for the third smart city in the global south","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Loss of state monopoly over data management may result in unregulated and uncontrolled data access and usage","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Intensive mobilization of smart urban technologies during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inequality in access to technology and data","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited access to healthcare data","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 disease in healthcare sectors","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Re-emergence of covid-19 due to relaxed control mechanisms","category":"Organizations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Delay or prevention of timely healthcare access due to technical solutions","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of awareness and transparency about data sharing and privacy risks in e-health technology","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases due to inadequate monitoring and compliance of self-isolation","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shortage of raw materials and labor force disrupts regular production","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Imbalance of supply for essential goods like n95 masks and hand sanitizers","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Imbalance in the supply chain for healthcare products such as ppe, ventilators, and drugs could lead to shortages, increasing the risk of healthcare workers and patients being exposed to contagious diseases","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Making covid-19 patient data available to the public","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of resources in healthcare facilities due to existing covid-19 patients","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Need to minimize the risk of healthcare professionals getting exposed to covid-19","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid spread of covid-19 due to sars-cov-2","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Travel restrictions and control","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Guidelines on social distancing","category":"Participation","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of proper covid-19 medical staff training","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate patient education","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ineffective mental and psychological treatment","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty in population size making it challenging to monitor the emergence of infections within a community from wastewater","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulties in estimating population size of individual wwtp catchments","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate surveillance of multiple diseases, including rare ones, in built environments","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient environmental monitoring of potential hazards in built environments","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Underreporting of cases due to lack of access to healthcare services","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Drivers affecting the emergence and reemergence of infectious diseases","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of information on competing financial interests or personal relationships","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Population size in the simulation not specified","category":"Capacity Development","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unemployment generated by the onus of keeping people at home","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ineffective social isolation policies leading to a higher number of infections and deaths","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"False dichotomy between healthcare and the economy","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of customization of social intervention scenarios for specific regions","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of focus on the social and economical aspects of pandemics in governmental policymaking","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited generalizability of results to wider contexts","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High number of deaths in certain scenarios","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Economic damage to businesses in certain scenarios","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"}]}
